dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.resource.res.log.prot.SwitchData
dataStructure.description:
This data type identifies the current protection switch status of a Protection Group or an SNCP reliable CTP. See supporting document SD1-34_protectionSwitch.

This datatype is extendable
dataStructure.label: SwitchData

child.name: protectionType
child.description:
This attribute identifies the type of the protection for which the switch has occurred.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is invariant

This attribute is optional
child.label: protectionType

child.name: switchReason
child.description:
This attribute contains the reason of the last switch. During a switch notification the switch reason is known. If it is not cached in the target OS for later retrieval, then a NOT_APPLICABLE value is assigned.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is invariant

This attribute is optional
child.label: switchReason

child.name: pgRef
child.description:
This attribute identifies the Protection Group in case of a trail protection switch. This is empty, if the protection type is SNCP.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is invariant

This attribute is optional
child.label: pgRef

child.name: layerRate
child.description:
This attribute identifies the layer at which the switch has occurred. The Layer Rate can be used to filter the switch notification.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is invariant

This attribute is optional
child.label: layerRate

child.name: protectedTpRef
child.description:
This attribute contains the name of the TP that is protected. The protected (worker) and protecting TPs are fixed in a revertive Protection Group, the worker can be active or not at any point in time. In a non-revertive Protection Group, there is no fixed worker / protecting distinction. The worker TP is indeed always the active TP; after a switch, the worker and protecting TPs exchange their roles. - For an SNCP, this is always the reliable TP. - For a retrieval of a 2F BLSR, each TP is protected, and two SwitchData instances are returned. - For a retrieval of a 4FMSSPR, each worker TP is protected, and two SwitchData instances are returned. - For a retrieval of a 1:N trail protection (e.g. MSP), each worker TP is protected, and N SwitchData instances are returned. - For a retrieval of a revertive 1+1 trail protection (e.g. MSP), this is always the worker TP. - For a retrieval of a non-revertive 1+1 trail protection (e.g. MSP) switch, this is the active TP. - This TP is a CTP for SNCP and a PTP for trail protection schemes.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is invariant

This attribute is optional
child.label: protectedTpRef

child.name: switchToTpRef
child.description:
This attribute identifies the TP which is being switched to and is the active source after the switch. This TP is a CTP for SNCP and a PTP for trail protection schemes.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is invariant

This attribute is optional
child.label: switchToTpRef

child.name: extensionInfo
child.description: a generic list of any type of elements. Used for vendor extensions or loose element encapsulation from other namespaces.
child.label: extensionInfo
